http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: This ontology represents the  terms to allow interoperability in DELTA project. It models concepts related to enery market, smart grids and demand-response platforms, and it will reuse standard ontologies whenever possible.
Action that is requested by a FEID
Legal entities that aggregate the load or generation of various demand and/or generation/production units and aim at optimizing energy supply and consumption.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Element contained in the FEID that detects and responds to events in an environment

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Limit of a value.
Aggrupation of elements, such as FEIDs or Virtual Nodes
Entity that consumes energy
Entity that interacts in the platform
Groups of customers
Reward associated to the customer in terms of monetary remuneration

An intelligent device, responsible for collecting information stemming from the field devices (home appliances, distributed energy resources, storage components etc.) to the DELTA Virtual Nodes and facilitate end-to-end communication of signals from/to the Aggregator and to/from the field devices. FEIDs will be equipped with smart meters measuring energy related data (e.g. consumption, generation, emissions, power coefficient, etc.) and through an intelligent lightweight toolkit compute real-time flexibility, providing them as input to the DVN Agent using fog computing techniques, aligned to a strategy (i.e. time interval) imposed to the specific Node by the Aggregator.
A feeder is physical asset which belongs to the system operator and used for transferring electricity from sub-stations to areas.
Frequency constraint related to the grid
Incentive (usually monetary) associated to energy values
Reliability and Fairness Index that refers to the distribution network configuration
Violation of the grid related to line loading.
Market settlement associated to an entity
Reward associated to the customer in terms of monetary remuneration
Violation of the grid related to overvoltage.
Monetary value associated to a contract
Phase of a measurement
Reward associated to the customer in terms of  points
Entity that produces energy
A specification associated to a Virtual Node or a device to collect information about properties
Entity that consumes or produces energy
Reward associated to the customers that is given after using the engagement tools
Reward associated to the customers that is given after using the engagement tools (e.g., discounts)
A section or zone
Computer program or a transaction protocol which is intended to automatically execute, control or document legally relevant events and actions according to the terms of a contract or an agreement
Constraints of the grid that limits a system
Transaction between entities that will be store in the smart contract
Violation of the grid
Condition associated to a violation. It indicates that the estimated measurement of a property does not coincide with the required one.

An aggregated, virtual cluster of prosumers which will be perceived and acted upon as a single, large prosumer entity by the Aggregator. Prosumers entailed into each Virtual Node will have common characteristics, defined by their corresponding Aggregator.
Voltage constraint related to the grid
Reward associated to the customer in terms of a voucher

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#isD.@value: Relationship between a smart contract and the property it agrees on.
Relation between a virtual node and its associated aggregator.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relationship between a virtual node and the cluster it belongs to.
Description of a cluster
Name of a cluster
Relation between an aggregator and the market settlement it consumes
Relationship between the FEID and the violation it detects.
Relationship identifying the properties associated to a group of entities, such as clusters.
A relationship defining the boundary values (min and max values) of an entity
Relation to define the comfort settings of a system.
Creation date of a profile
Link between a price and its currency
Link to the delivery time.
Duration description of a violation, indicanting value and unit.
Relationship between a violation condition and the current associated measurement that is estimated.
Granularity of the profile (e.g., weekly, daily)
URI of the endpoint
A relation between a property and its incentives associated.
Link between a Virtual Node and its index.
IP address of a thing
A relationship defining the lower boundary of an entity (e.g. a comfort setting).
Relation between a smart contract and the payment associated
Link between a phase and a measurement
Address of the service within the system.
Link between an entity and its profile
Redundancy of  a FEID
Reliability associated to a virtual node
Relationship between a violation condition and the associated measurement that is required.
Link between a customer and its associated reward
A relationship defining the value of a certain reward, e.g., points or money
link between the Virtual node and its smart contracts
Link to the grid constraints of a system
Link between a smart contracts and the transactions it stores
A relationship defining the upper boundary of an entity (e.g. a comfort setting).
Relationship between a violation and all its conditions
Relationship between a violation and its type, which can be overvoltage, undervoltage or overloading.
DR type that is implemented by the FEID, which can be implicit or explicit
Relationship between a violation and  a profile that describes such violation
Link from a virtual node to its aggregator
Value that indicates whether the FEID is available
A relationship defining the currency associated to a value
Relation between an object and the geographical feature in which it is located at
Link between a device and its customer
Relationship between a profile and a device.
Relationship  between a violation and the related DVNs, FEIDs or Feeders.
Relationship between  an action and the virtual node in charge of perform it
Period where an entity, such a contract, is valid
Relation between a Virutal Node and the  devices it manages
Date when a violation occurs
Link between the customers and the devices
Relationship between a grid violation and the requested property to solve it.
Relationship between a DR request and the needed measurement in order to solve a violation
Name of a sector
The final status as if the DVN fullfiled the request or it failed
A relationship that indicates whether a FEID accepts or rejects DR requests automatically.
This class represents the top-level feature type. This class is equivalent to GFI_Feature defined in ISO 19156:2011, and it is superclass of all feature types.
The class represents the top-level geometry type. This class is equivalent to the UML class GM_Object defined in ISO 19107, and it is superclass of all geometry types.
A spatial representation for a given feature.

Anything with spatial extent, i.e. size, shape, or position.
 e.g. people, places, bowling balls, as well as abstract areas like cubes.
Duration of a temporal extent expressed as a number scaled by a temporal unit
A temporal entity with zero extent or duration
A temporal entity with an extent or duration
A temporal interval or instant.

A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in households, common public buildings or offices. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. For example, a washing machine is designed to wash (task) and to accomplish this task it performs a start and stop function. Devices can be structured in categories (subclasses) that reflect the different domain in which a device is used, e.g., smart appliances domain (subclass FunctionRelated) vs. building domain (subclass BuildingRelated) vs. smart grid domain (subclass EnergyRelated). New categories can be defined,if needed, to reflect other differences, for example different points of view, such as the point of view of the device's user vs. the point of view of the device's manufacturer. We propose a list of devices that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.
A property related to measurements that are characterized  by a value measured in energy units
A feature of interest represents any real world entity from which a property is measured.
A property related to measurements that are characterized  by a value measured in power units
A saref:Property crelated to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured using saref:Currency

A specification associated to a device to collect information about a certain Property (e.g., Energy) or Commodity (e.g.Water) for optimizing its usage in the home, office or building in which the device is located. This specification is about a certain Property or Commodity (saref:isAbout), can be calculated over a time span (saref:hasTime ) and can be associated to some costs (saref:hasPrice). An example is the Power Profile defined in the SAREF4ENER extension that can be associated to a device for optimizing the Energy efficiency in the home, office or building in which the device is located.
A quality of a feature of interest that can be measured; an aspect of a feature of interest that is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the feature

The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example,  Power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power called \"watt\". Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). We propose here a list of some units of measure that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended, also using some other ontologies rather than the Ontology of units of Measure (OM).
A relationship indicating a composite entity that consists of other entities (e.g., a temperature/humidity sensor that consists of a temperature sensor and a humidity sensor)
A relationship stating the timestamp of an entity (e.g. a measurement).

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: A relationship defining the value of a certain property, e.g., energy or power. Note that, even if numeric values are expected to enable reasoning, measurement values could use other datatypes.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A relationship identifying what an entity, such as a Profile, is about
A relationship between a measurement and the feature of interest whose quality was measured
A relationship specifying the property that can be measured by a certain device
A relationship specifying the property that can be measured by a certain device
A relationship between a property and the measurements it relates to
A relationship between a measurement and the property it relates to
is derived from
quantifies KPI
This is the OpenADR Virtual End Node that is used to interact with the VTN
This is the OpenADR Virtual Top Node that is used to interact with the Resources enrolled in the DR Programs.
Relationship between a VE, Resource or Asset with the Group of targets associated
Relationship between an event and its duration

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Item base in order to define the unit of measure
Link to the payload of a report

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: has randomization
Link to the report identifier
A link between a node and the event it sends
